trans-unit.source: Defines properties and events that must be implemented to allow a control to act like a button on a Web page.
The IButtonControl interface defines the properties and events that must be implemented to allow a control to act like a button on a Web page.

The members of this interface provide basic button functionality, such as the ability to raise a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Click> event and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.PostBackUrl%2A> property provides cross-page posting functionality.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking the button causes page validation to occur.

A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the CausesValidation property to indicate whether clicking the button causes page validation to occur.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if clicking the button causes page validation to occur; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the button control is clicked.
The Click event is raised when the button control is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
Occurs when the button control is clicked.
The Command event is raised when the button control is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
To be added.
Gets or sets an optional argument that is propagated to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command"></xref> event.

A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the CommandArgument property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.CommandName%2A> property to indicate the argument and command name that are propagated to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command> event.
The argument that is propagated to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command"></xref> event.
Gets or sets the command name that is propagated to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command"></xref> event.

A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.CommandArgument%2A> property and the CommandName property to indicate the argument and command name that are propagated to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command> event.
The name of the command that is propagated to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.Command"></xref> event.
Gets or sets the URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when the button control is clicked.
You can use the PostBackUrl property to perform a cross-page post.
If the PostBackUrl property is set to the page that the button is currently on, a normal postback event cycle occurs.

A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the PostBackUrl property to indicate the URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when the button control is clicked.
The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when the button control is clicked.
Gets or sets the text caption displayed for the button.
A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the Text property to indicate the text caption displayed for the button.
The text caption displayed for the button.
Gets or sets the name for the group of controls for which the button control causes validation when it posts back to the server.

A control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> interface must implement the ValidationGroup property to indicate the name for the group of controls for which the button control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
The name for the group of controls for which the button control causes validation when it posts back to the server.
